file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-20-11-04 - NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTECTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTECTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the lights protection of the nose landing gear. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTEC- ALL 32-20-11-000-801-A TION - REMOVAL NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTEC- ALL 32-20-11-400-801-A TION - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-20-11 Page 1 of 7 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-11-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTECTION - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the lights protection of the nose landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AIRCRAFT SAFE PROCEDURES FOR MAINTE- AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 NANCE SERVICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 860-002-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. (1) Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). (2) Make sure that the safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve is installed (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that the safety pins of the landing gears are installed ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-11 Page 2 of 7 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Nose-Landing-Gear Lights Protection - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (Figure 401, Sheet 1) (Figure 401, Sheet 2) (1) Remove the sealants (4) of the nuts (8) and (11), bolts (10) and (13) that attach the lights protection (2) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (2) Remove the sealants (4) of the nut (3) and bolt (7) that attach the clamps (6) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (3) Remove the nut (3), washers (5) and bolt (7) that attach the clamps (6) on the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (4) Remove the clamps (6) from the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (5) Cut, remove and discard the tie-wrap (1) that attach the electrical cable of the lights on the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 1. (6) Remove the nuts (8) and (11), washers (9) and (12), bolts (10) and (13) to release the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (7) Remove the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-20-11 Page 3 of 7 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-20-11-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTECTION - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the lights protection of the nose landing gear. (2) The approved sealants for this procedure are: NOTE: Do not mix the two sealants. • PR1776M B2 654 SEMKIT • PR 1826 B2 ALO + P B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AIRCRAFT SAFE PROCEDURES FOR MAINTE- AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 NANCE SERVICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES NOSE-LANDING-GEAR LIGHTS PROTECTION - RE- AMM TASK 32-20-11-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Polythioeter Sealant PR 1826 B2 ALO + P, Rapid Curing, AMS3277 AR CLASS B2, TYPE I Polisulfide Sealant PR1776M B2 654 SEMKIT, Class B2 AMS3281 AR Low-Density G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose landing gear EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-20-11 Page 6 of 7 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 860-003-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. (1) Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). (2) Make sure that the aircraft is in the same configuration as it was at the end of the removal task (AMM TASK 32-20-11-000-801-A/400). J. Nose-Landing-Gear Lights Protection - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (Figure 401, Sheet 1) (Figure 401, Sheet 2) (1) Put the lights protection (2) in its installation position. Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (2) Install the bolts (10) and (13), washers (9) and (12), nuts (8) and (11). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (3) Use the torque wrench to torque the nuts (8) and (11) to 3.95 - 4.52 N.m (35 - 40 lb.in). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (4) Install the tie-wraps (1) that attach the electrical cable of the lights on the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 1. (5) Install the clamps (6) on the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (6) Install the bolt (7), washers (5), and nut (3) that attach the clamps (6) on the lights protection (2). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (7) Apply the approved sealant (4) to the nut (3) and head of the bolt (7) that attach the clamps (6) on the lights protection (2) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. (8) Apply the approved sealant (4) to the nuts (8) and (11), head of the bolts (10) and (13) that attach the lights protection (2) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to Figure 401, Sheet 2. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 940-002-A (1) Remove from the work area all tools, equipment, and materials that you used.
